name.value: Le Strade d'Inchiostro: Edizione Rosso Fiammante
レイルロード・インク:ブレイズレッド・エディション

item.description:
In the multiplayer puzzle game Railroad Ink, your goal is to connect as many exits on your board as possible. Each round, a set of dice are rolled in the middle of the table, determining which kind of road and railway routes are available to all players. You have to draw these routes on your erasable boards to create transport lines and connect your exits, trying to optimize the available symbols better than your opponents.

The more exits you connect, the more points you score at the end of the game, but you lose points for each incomplete route, so plan carefully! Will you press your luck and try to stretch your transportation network to the next exit, or will you play it safe and start a new, simpler to manage route?

Railroad Ink comes in two versions, each one including two expansions with additional dice sets that add special rules to your games. The Blazing Red Edition includes the Lava and Meteor expansions. Try to confine the lava coming from the erupting volcano before it destroys your routes, or deal with the havoc brought by the meteor strikes and mine the craters for precious ore. These special rules can spice up things and make each game play and feel different.

Each box allows you to play from 1 to 6 players, and if you combine more boxes, you can play with up to 12 players (or more). The only limit to the number of players is the number of boards you have!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

comment.value: roll and write, seems fun, for lots of people

+ Extremely easy to set up, and carry around + Short play time, but will immediately want to play again + Fun with many players or solo + Cute art, great component quality - Meteor theme more absurd (could be good or bad) than the blue version - Minimal player interactions
This is an excellent and unique gem in the roll-and-write genre. The meteors are an interesting addition for changing up the base/ blue version of the game.
Interesting to hear that it is a weaker version of Karuba. Charmander version.
Fantastic little game with surprising depth in such a small package. The wipe-clean boards are great

Emerging from the sea of roll and writes, Railroad Ink is a charming, puzzley, gateway-level game that's quick to learn and interesting to play. The dice dictate which roads and railways you can and can't draw each round. This means that I've been praying to the dice Gods in the final round many times. But yet, with all the possibilities, I don't feel like the dice are cheating me. In fact, I've found myself thinking about what I could have done differently and have consequently developed a bunch of strategies. That said, this is still a dice game and there are no mechanisms for mitigating the rolls in each round: I have had a couple of frustrating games with absolutely no rolls of the corner railroad, for example. As for the expansion dice, I've only ever used them a couple of times. They're fine, but we've played the base game about 40 times without feeling the need to change the game.
Great, fun game. First time I played it, we played 4 times straight. I foresee a lot of more plays in the future.

An excellent roll-and-write game. Roll the dice, and everyone then sits down and draws a bit more on to their map. Love how you're going back and forth between the railroads and the highways. I haven't even gotten into the advanced rules, and already this is something I'd love to have, even if it's just as a fun, quick solo game.
One of the best games of 2018. Volcanoes are OP. Meteors are a small inconvenience.

All of our games are new in shrink and in perfect condition. All prices are included 21% VAT. Payment can be done by wire transfer, PayPal is possible if 5% fee is added at your cost. We always look for the best shipping prices for you, but as it varies per location it is recommended to ask for shipping costs before ordering if you cannot find your country below: Belgium: €3,99 to a DPD/bpost pickup point or €5,99 to an address Czech: €22,99 to an address Denmark: €15,99 to a DPD pickup point or €18,99 to an address France: €10,99 to a DPD pickup point or €13,49 to an address Germany: €7,49 to a DPD pickup point or €9,99 to an address Greece: €33,99 to an address Italy: €20,99 to an address Luxembourg: €11,99 to an address The Netherlands: €7,49 to a DPD pickup point or €9,99 to an address Spain: €28,99 to an address Sweden: €22,99 to an address United Kingdom: €12,49 to a DPD pickup point or €15,49 to an address All packages will be shipped securely with tracking, and protected well. We do not ship outside of EU. We also have various pickup points in Belgium and the Netherlands such as Bruges, Ghent, Antwerpen, Boom, Kortenberg, Tielt, Aalst, Rotterdam, Amsterdam, Utrecht, Groningen and many more! Picking up is perfectly possible, please contact us about that matter if you prefer that! Please note we try to keep the stock at BGG up to date, however it may happen it is out of stock if you order because we are also selling it in our own website.
